means: 有怪想的，反复无常的，想入非非的

sentence.Network_en: He is a crotchety old man.
sentence.Network_cn: 他是个脾气暴躁的老头。

sentence.Network_en: His crotchety, even cruel behavior must be mischaracterized too.
sentence.Network_cn: 他反复无常 、 甚至是残酷的行为一定也是由于复杂的性格原因.

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 19th cent.: from sense 2 of crotchet + -y

entry.tran: 脾气坏的;易怒的;动辄生气的
entry.def: A crotchety person is bad-tempered and easily irritated.

means.word_mean: 1. having a difficult and contrary disposition;

sentences.sentence: "a cantankerous and venomous-tongued old lady"- Dorothy Sayers

auth_sentence.content: Its old, crotchety morons like yourself who come into conversations with preconcieved ideas about how things are going to go.
auth_sentence.res_content: Its old, crotchety morons like yourself who come into conversations with preconcieved ideas about how things are going to go.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Its old, crotchety morons like yourself who come into conversations with preconcieved ideas about how things are going to go.

auth_sentence.content: Calagione looked washed out and a little crotchety a rare thing after one too many glasses of grappa the night before.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Calagione looked washed out and a little crotchety a rare thing after one too many glasses of grappa the night before.

auth_sentence.content: True to his occasional crotchety nature, though, he complained about being famous or bothered by fans.
